intro: Rhynchospora leptostachya, commonly known as slender-stalked beakspur, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is native to various regions of the Americas and typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually pale green to brown, and it is often found in association with other wetland vegetation. Rhynchospora leptostachya plays a role in supporting local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates.
